TopicTitle: Having an issue with random crashes at random times with these mods

Articles.Content:
The mods I'm using aren't all that extensive or anything.

-B9 Aerospace Pack R 4.0

-KSP Interstellar v.9.2

-Ferram AerospaceResearch .1.2.3

-MechJeb2 2.1.1.01.

I get random crashes at random times, and really not sure at all why. Things work fine without the mods. WOrked fine with just Interstellar and MechJeb2 as well, but after B9 and Ferram now I'm getting intermingled crashes.

Error Log: http://www./view/n8hg5rf0923q5f9/error.log

Edited January 1, 2014 by LadyAthena

Well, without a crash log we can't tell what's happening, but I'll bet that you're running out of memory. The thing is, B9 is kind of a memory hog, and I'll be Interstellar eats quite a bit as well. If that's the case, your only solution is to install one of the texture reduction packs.

I'd be highly surprised if I was running out of memory. Seeing as how I can play much more memory extensive games than this with no issue. However, I could upload the crash log.

It crashes at random times. Could be when I decide to take off with a new ship I just created. When I try to go back to base. etc. It never crashes while I'm flying, generally everytime I try to switch to a new thing, or end a mission, etc. But like I said, it happens at very random times.

It could crash when I try to go back to mission control, I'll re load the game, and go to mission control no issue after the re load.

Edited January 1, 2014 by LadyAthena
KSP is a 32 bit application; it can only use up to 4 GB of RAM. Trust me, you're probably running out of memory, it's the only type of crash that ever happens in this game.
I didn't realize that. So it has nothing to do with my computer, but more the game itself. I did upload the error log.
Yeah, it looks like you're running out of memory. Time to go and look for what you're not going to use in those mods and get rid of them and install the texture reduction packs.
"0xc0000005" yep that's the memory crash code. An output_log.txt could confirm it.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/59005-0-23-Release-2-6-Active-Memory-Reduction-Mod?highlight=Texture+reduction Well I'm gonna try this, and lowering the settings ingame. See if it works. Thanks for the help ^.^
